name: Melancholy
text:
Enchant creature
When Melancholy enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Melancholy unless you pay {B}.

name: Melee
text:
Cast Melee only during your turn and only during combat before blockers are declared.
You choose which creatures block this combat and how those creatures block.
Whenever a creature attacks and isn't blocked this combat, untap it and remove it from combat.

name: Melek, Izzet Paragon
text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may cast the top card of your library if it's an instant or sorcery card.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell from your library, copy it. You may choose new targets for the copy.

name: Melesse Spirit
text: Flying, protection from black

editions.flavor: Like a laughing knife, immaculate and sharp, is the Melesse.

name: Meletis Astronomer
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Meletis Astronomer, look at the top three cards of your library. You may reveal an enchantment card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Meletis Charlatan
text: {2}{U}, {T}: The controller of target instant or sorcery spell copies it. That player may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor: "Every object has an echo in the Æther beyond the world. Every idea has a shadow that can be brought to light."

name: Melira's Keepers
text: Melira's Keepers can't have counters placed on it.

editions.flavor: Her warriors are the last defense against the coming storm.

name: Melira, Sylvok Outcast
text:
You can't get poison counters.
Creatures you control can't have -1/-1 counters placed on them.
Creatures your opponents control lose infect.

editions.flavor: Once a pariah, now Mirrodin's greatest hope.

name: Meloku the Clouded Mirror
text:
Flying
{1}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Create a 1/1 blue Illusion creature token with flying.

editions.flavor: He loved his cities in the clouds. When he traveled to the lands below, he brought many reminders of his home.
He loved his cities in the clouds. When he traveled to the lands below, he brought many reminders of his home.

name: Meltdown
text: Destroy each artifact with converted mana cost X or less.

editions.flavor: Catastrophes happened so often at the mana rig that the viashino language had a special word to describe them.

name: Melting
text: All lands are no longer snow.

editions.flavor:
"Who needs the sun when you've got me around?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Melt Terrain
text: Destroy target land. Melt Terrain deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

editions.flavor: Just as the most finely wrought metal can warp and rust, so too does Mirrodin buckle under pressures from without and within.

name: Memnarch
text:
{1}{U}{U}: Target permanent becomes an artifact in addition to its other types. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
{3}{U}: Gain control of target artifact. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor: In the blur between metal and flesh, Memnarch found madness.
In the blur between metal and flesh, Memnarch found madness.
"An imperfection in the perfect world? We can't allow that."
Reminders of Memnarch's reign still skirr across Mirrodin, reminiscent of his form if not his power.
Reminders of Memnarch's reign still skirr across Mirrodin, reminiscent of his form if not his power.

name: Memoricide
text: Name a nonland card. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

editions.flavor: "You claim wisdom, yet I see nothing in here but tawdry wishes."
"You claim wisdom, yet I see nothing in here but tawdry wishes."

name: Memory
text:
Aftermath (Cast this spell only from your graveyard. Then exile it.)
Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library, then draws seven cards.

name: Memory Crystal
text: Buyback costs cost {2} less.

editions.flavor: Hues of recollection flicker like facets of a gem.

name: Memory Erosion
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"The Filigree Texts do not compel you to act in accordance with their precepts. They only specify the consequences should you fail."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn

"The Filigree Texts do not compel you to act in accordance with their precepts. They only specify the consequences should you fail."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn

name: Memory Jar
text: {T}, Sacrifice Memory Jar: Each player exiles all cards from his or her hand face down and draws seven cards. At the beginning of the next end step, each player discards his or her hand and returns to his or her hand each card he or she exiled this way.

name: Memory Lapse
text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Um . . . oh . . . what was I saying?"
—Reveka, wizard savant

"Um...oh...what was I saying?"
—Reveka, wizard savant
"Eri phar phesta . . . um, phistor . . . er, phistara . . ."

"To sculpt a mind is to see every memory and thought as an individual piece that can be rearranged—or removed."
—Jace Beleren

"Um . . . oh . . . what was I saying?"
—Reveka, Wizard Savant

"Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it."
—Chandler

"Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it."
—Chandler
What a lonely agony, the memory of memories lost.

"The caliph was so intelligent he could not remember what he knew."
—Azeworai, "Three Riddles"

name: Memory Plunder
text: You may cast target instant or sorcery card from an opponent's graveyard without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor:
"Vengeance is the echo of the victim's own crime."
—Grensch, merrow cutthroat

name: Memory's Journey
text:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Memory Sluice
text:
Target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Conspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Menacing Ogre
text:
Trample, haste
When Menacing Ogre enters the battlefield, each player secretly chooses a number. Then those numbers are revealed. Each player with the highest number loses that much life. If you are one of those players, put two +1/+1 counters on Menacing Ogre.

name: Menagerie Liberator
text:
Trample
Melee (Whenever this creature attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each opponent you attacked with a creature this combat.)

editions.flavor: "The wild are neither your thralls nor your amusement."

name: Mending Hands
text: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor:
"I can staunch their blood, mend their flesh, and knit their bones. But I cannot restore their hope."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer

"I can staunch their blood, mend their flesh, and knit their bones. But I cannot restore their hope."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer

name: Mending Touch
text: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor:
"The gift of life must be freely given. Anything less would diminish us all."
—Arin, Selesnya healer

name: Meng Huo, Barbarian King
text: Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.

editions.flavor: The stubborn Meng Huo was captured and released by Kongming seven times before finally surrendering.
The stubborn Meng Huo was captured and released by Kongming seven times before finally surrendering.
Through his allies, Meng Huo commanded several hundred thousand troops composed of cavalry, rattan-armored warriors, infantry, naked men with swords, and wild animals.
Through his allies, Meng Huo commanded several hundred thousand troops composed of cavalry, rattan-armored warriors, infantry, naked men with swords, and wild animals.

name: Mental Agony
text: Target player discards two cards and loses 2 life.

editions.flavor: "His mind is feeble. Feed him to the bats."

name: Mental Discipline
text: {1}{U}, Discard a card: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Barrin drowned his doubts about Urza's project by delving ever deeper into its details.

name: Mental Misstep
text:
({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)
Counter target spell with converted mana cost 1.

editions.flavor:
"Your first mistake was thinking I would let you live long enough to make a second."
—Sarnvax, Gitaxian sective

name: Mental Note
text:
Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Some minds are more open than others.

name: Mental Vapors
text:
Target player discards a card.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

name: Mentor of the Meek
text: Whenever another creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor: "In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."
"In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."
"In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."

name: Mephidross Vampire
text:
Flying
Each creature you control is a Vampire in addition to its other creature types and has "Whenever this creature deals damage to a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."

name: Mephitic Ooze
text:
Mephitic Ooze gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
Whenever Mephitic Ooze deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. The creature can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor: In Mephidross, refuse doesn't last long—it's all scavenged, reanimated, or consumed.

name: Mercadian Atlas
text: At the beginning of your end step, if you didn't play a land this turn, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: One may as well chart the clouds as try to map Mercadia.

name: Mercadian Bazaar
text:
Mercadian Bazaar enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Mercadian Bazaar.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Mercadian Bazaar: Add {R} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

name: Mercadian Lift
text:
{1}, {T}: Put a winch counter on Mercadian Lift.
{T}, Remove X winch counters from Mercadian Lift: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand onto the battlefield.

name: Mercadia's Downfall
text: Each attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each nonbasic land defending player controls.

editions.flavor: With an explosion that shook the foundation of the city, the Weatherlight burst from the underground hangar.

name: Mercenaries
text: {3}: The next time Mercenaries would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. Any player may activate this ability.

editions.flavor:
"Blasted amateurs! Doesn't the queen think we can fight well enough on our own?"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Mercenary Informer
text:
Mercenary Informer can't be the target of black spells or abilities from black sources.
{2}{W}: Put target nontoken Mercenary on the bottom of its owner's library.

editions.flavor: The problem with rebels is that they so quickly reject authority.

name: Mercenary Knight
text: When Mercenary Knight enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.

name: Merchant of Secrets
text: When Merchant of Secrets enters the battlefield, draw a card.

editions.flavor: To scrape out a living in Aphetto, wizards are reduced to selling rumors, lies, forgeries, or—if they get desperate enough—the truth.
To scrape out a living in Aphetto, wizards are reduced to selling rumors, lies, forgeries, or—if they get desperate enough—the truth.

name: Merchant Scroll
text: Search your library for a blue instant card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"There's no trade without trust."
—Eron, the Relentless
Lat-Nam wizards trade knowledge on scrolls made of magic so they can better guard against thieves and spies.

name: Merchant's Dockhand
text: {3}{U}, {T}, Tap X untapped artifacts you control: Look at the top X cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

editions.flavor:
"If you can build it, we can move it."
—Bes Tavani, Bomat merchant

name: Merchant Ship
text:
Merchant Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
Whenever Merchant Ship attacks and isn't blocked, you gain 2 life.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Merchant Ship.

name: Merciless Eviction
text:
Choose one —
• Exile all artifacts.
• Exile all creatures.
• Exile all enchantments.
• Exile all planeswalkers.

editions.flavor:
"I once saw the Obzedat moved to action. Since that day, I've been thankful that they're mainly lazy, and dead."
—Aurelia, to Gideon Jura

name: Merciless Executioner
text: When Merciless Executioner enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

editions.flavor: He enjoys his work, for he sees only the worst Abzan criminals: those who betray their own kin.

name: Merciless Javelineer
text: {2}, Discard a card: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. That creature can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: "My mind is the calm in the midst of the storm, and my javelin the lightning."

name: Merciless Predator
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Merciless Predator.

editions.flavor: Before she just wanted to snatch your purse; now she'll take the whole arm.

name: Merciless Resolve
text:
As an additional cost to cast Merciless Resolve, sacrifice a creature or land.
Draw two cards.

editions.flavor: "You sought to anger me, Nahiri. Soon you will see how well you have succeeded."

name: Mercurial Chemister
text:
{U}, {T}: Draw two cards.
{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Mercurial Chemister deals damage to target creature equal to the discarded card's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: What some see as "distracted" is really "fathoming the unfathomable."

name: Mercurial Geists
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Mercurial Geists gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Procedural misstep: provocation of geists for the purpose of yielding more energy can compromise containment units. Next action: clean up mess."
—Laboratory notes

name: Mercurial Kite
text:
Flying
Whenever Mercurial Kite deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

name: Mercurial Pretender
text: You may have Mercurial Pretender enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature you control, except it gains "{2}{U}{U}: Return this creature to its owner's hand."

editions.flavor: The king went off to find himself. Imagine his terror when he succeeded.
The king went off to find himself. Imagine his terror when he succeeded.

name: Mercy Killing
text: Target creature's controller sacrifices it, then creates X 1/1 green and white Elf Warrior creature tokens, where X is that creature's power.

editions.flavor: "We will give you the peace you seek, though you may not yet know you seek it."

name: Mer-Ek Nightblade
text:
Outlast {B} ({B}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has deathtouch.

name: Meren of Clan Nel Toth
text:
Whenever another creature you control dies, you get an experience counter.
At the beginning of your end step, choose target creature card in your graveyard. If that card's converted mana cost is less than or equal to the number of experience counters you have, return it to the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your hand.

name: Merfolk Assassin
text: {T}: Destroy target creature with islandwalk.

name: Merfolk Looter
text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

editions.flavor: Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.
When you sink a lot of ships, it's easy to find sunken treasure.
Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.
In the depths of Rootwater, salvage and sewage differ only in texture.
In the depths of Rootwater, salvage and sewage differ only in texture.

It belongs to the merfolk now.
—Shipwreck prayer
Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.
Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.

name: Merfolk Mesmerist
text: {U}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Don't you think if I saw a half-woman, half-fish with three glowing eyes, I'd have remembered?"
—Drugo, town guard
www.MagicTheGathering.com

name: Merfolk Observer
text: When Merfolk Observer enters the battlefield, look at the top card of target player's library.

editions.flavor: "The structure gets bigger every hour, with hedrons coalescing even deep under the surface. If I could only get inside . . . ."

name: Merfolk of the Depths
text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)

editions.flavor: When giant sinkholes opened across Ravnica, they revealed buried oceans and the merfolk, once thought to be extinct.

Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.
Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

"The paladins would be wise not to forget about the Pearl Trident. The merfolk warriors have turned the tide of more than one human war . . . and I have no doubt they shall do so again."
—Onean scholar

—Kalis, Onean scholar

name: Merfolk Raiders
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)

editions.flavor:
"Turn your back for a second and they just vanish! As if they weren't shifty enough before."
—Rhirhok, goblin archer

name: Merfolk Seastalkers
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{2}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.

editions.flavor:
"Do they seek knowledge or wealth? Are they bandits or benefactors? It depends on who is chanting the tale."
—Nikou, Joraga bard

name: Merfolk Seer
text: When Merfolk Seer dies, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
The sea leaves no room for tears.
—Zhalfirin adage

name: Merfolk Skyscout
text:
Flying
Whenever Merfolk Skyscout attacks or blocks, untap target permanent.

editions.flavor: "Emeria is a pleasant lie, a figment to hide Emrakul's hideous face. I can only hope to uncover a truth that lies deeper still."
"Emeria is a pleasant lie, a figment to hide Emrakul's hideous face. I can only hope to uncover a truth that lies deeper still."

name: Merfolk Sovereign
text:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Target Merfolk creature can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: "The sharks envy our ferocity. The eels envy our cunning."
"Be like the sea: flow around that which is unmovable; for everything else, crash into it unrelentingly."

name: Merfolk Spy
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Whenever Merfolk Spy deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals a card at random from his or her hand.

name: Merfolk Thaumaturgist
text: {T}: Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Blasted fishtails! It's not enough that they meddle with my head, but they twist my body as well."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

name: Merfolk Traders
text: When Merfolk Traders enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.

editions.flavor:
"As much as I hate water, I do love fish . . . ."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Merfolk Wayfinder
text:
Flying
When Merfolk Wayfinder enters the battlefield, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all Island cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Merieke Ri Berit
text:
Merieke Ri Berit doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Merieke Ri Berit. When Merieke Ri Berit leaves the battlefield or becomes untapped, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.

name: Merrow Bonegnawer
text:
{T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her graveyard.
Whenever you cast a black spell, you may untap Merrow Bonegnawer.

editions.flavor: Banished to the Dark Meanders for hideous crimes, some merrows find a taste for the darkness . . . and the dead.

name: Merrow Commerce
text: At the beginning of your end step, untap all Merfolk you control.

editions.flavor: Schools meet and mingle on Lorwyn's riverways. In the bustling interplay, the merrow renew their sense of community as they sharpen their wits and hone their trading skills.

name: Merrow Grimeblotter
text: {1}{U/B}, {Q}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

editions.flavor: Grimeblotters spend so much time in the Dark Meanders that they're able to bring a piece with them wherever they go.

name: Merrow Harbinger
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
When Merrow Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Merfolk card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

name: Merrow Levitator
text:
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, you may untap Merrow Levitator.

editions.flavor: He fancies himself a master thief, claiming to "steal the ground" from his victims.

name: Merrow Reejerey
text:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a Merfolk spell, you may tap or untap target permanent.

editions.flavor: Steady and silent as the deep current, the reejerey guides the course of the school.
Steady and silent as the deep current, the reejerey guides the course of the school.

name: Merrow Wavebreakers
text: {1}{U}, {Q}: Merrow Wavebreakers gains flying until end of turn. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

editions.flavor: The merrows' prey have retreated from the shore, so they have learned to follow.

name: Merrow Witsniper
text: When Merrow Witsniper enters the battlefield, target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: "The world above the waterline must be monitored—and, when necessary, adjusted."

name: Merseine
text:
Enchant creature
Merseine enters the battlefield with three net counters on it.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step if Merseine has a net counter on it.
Pay enchanted creature's mana cost: Remove a net counter from Merseine. Any player may activate this ability, but only if he or she controls the enchanted creature.

name: Mesa Chicken
text: Stand up, Flap your arms, Cluck like a chicken: Mesa Chicken gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Lo! lord of layers proudly comb-crested
Hero to hens father to feathers
Crowing sun-caller weaver of wattle
Elder to eggs."
—Rooster Saga

name: Mesa Enchantress
text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: She shepherds mysteries and dust as others would a flock of sheep.
She shepherds mysteries and dust as others would a flock of sheep.
"Scholars seek to understand the way the world is. I wish to shape the world into what it should be."
"Scholars seek to understand the way the world is. I wish to shape the world into what it should be."
She shepherds mysteries and dust as others would a flock of sheep.

name: Mesa Falcon
text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Mesa Falcon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The faith of Serra is borne on wings of hope."
—Gulsen, abbey matron

"Pretty Falcon, friend to Soraya. Will you send her my greetings?"
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

"The faith of Serra is borne on wings of hope."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

"The faith of Serra is borne on wings of hope."
—Gulsen, abbey matron

name: Mesa Pegasus
text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

name: Mesmeric Fiend
text:
When Mesmeric Fiend enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals his or her hand and you choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.
When Mesmeric Fiend leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to its owner's hand.

name: Mesmeric Orb
text: Whenever a permanent becomes untapped, that permanent's controller puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: A step in one direction is two steps away from another.

name: Mesmeric Sliver
text: All Slivers have "When this permanent enters the battlefield, you may fateseal 1." (To fateseal 1, its controller looks at the top card of an opponent's library, then he or she may put that card on the bottom of that library.)

name: Mesmeric Trance
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{U}, Discard a card: Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Magic overused can freeze the mind. Creativity is more important than power."
—Zur the Enchanter

"Magic overused can freeze the mind. Creativity is more important than power."
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Messenger Drake
text:
Flying
When Messenger Drake dies, draw a card.

editions.flavor: The more important the message, the larger the messenger.

name: Messenger Falcons
text:
Flying
When Messenger Falcons enters the battlefield, draw a card.

editions.flavor: So many aven had died scouting the distant fronts that the knight-captains recruited Nayan falcons as couriers.

name: Messenger Jays
text:
Flying
Council's dilemma — When Messenger Jays enters the battlefield, starting with you, each player votes for feather or quill. Put a +1/+1 counter on Messenger Jays for each feather vote and draw a card for each quill vote. For each card drawn this way, discard a card.

name: Messenger's Speed
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has trample and haste.

editions.flavor:
"He outran arrows. He outran even the archers' insults."
—Bayma, storyteller of Lagonna Band

name: Metal Fatigue
text: Tap all artifacts.

editions.flavor: The Auriok have fought the metal hordes for so long now that knowing how to cripple them has become an instinct.

name: Metallic Mastery
text: Gain control of target artifact until end of turn. Untap that artifact. It gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"All will be reforged in the fires of glory."
—Urabrask the Hidden

name: Metallic Mimic
text:
As Metallic Mimic enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Metallic Mimic is the chosen type in addition to its other types.
Each other creature you control of the chosen type enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
